column4: Has anyone else had trouble with the latest xorg drivers breaking OpenGL? I'm using nvidia binary drivers (from envy)
when you do an update of Xorg, you should reinstall your nvidia drivers, it will mess up your libraries, and cause x to crash with opengl apps.
I reinstalled binary nvidia drivers, but opengl is still broken (crashes X)
this happend after I installed the patches today (think they came out yesterday)
yes, this happened with me, usually after an X update, when I used Nvidia.
look in your ~/.xsession-errors
you the one that told me to post my xsession-errors to pastebin? I crashed X and didn't have logging on ...
it crashed before logging in?
if you can switch to Console, before you log back in, then copy the .xsession-errors to another file, then log in, then it will be better. .xsession-errors gets rewritten everytime you log in.
yea - I realized that so I did just that - the file is at http://pastebin.com/857274
I also diff'd my xorg.conf against the backup copy that was made before the xorg patch today and it shows no differences
pastbin.com, does not like me for some reason, please use http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/
yes, Xorg.log is only for the startup of X.
I think the error line is: Vte-WARNING **: No handler for control sequence `device-control-string' defined.
everything else looks "normal"
